timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            library is not fully compatible with Graal so we had to do some integration work to make this work.
          
          
            
            library is not fully compatible with GraalVM so we had to do some integration work to make this work.
timeline.author: gsmet
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -241,3 +241,9 @@ you'll see this:
 ----
 
 This environment variable resolves some incompatibilities between Quarkus and the Amazon Lambda Custom Runtime environment.
+
+== Tracing with AWS XRay and Graal
+
+If you are building native images, and want to use https://aws.amazon.com/xray[AWS XRay Tracing] with your lambda
+you will need to include `quarkus-amazon-lambda-xray` as a dependency in your pom.  The Aws Xray
+library is not fully compatible with Graal so we had to do some integration work to make this work.

Suggested change

timeline.author: gsmet
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -246,4 +246,10 @@ The native image can also be locally tested using the `sam.native.yaml` template
 [source]
 ----
 sam local invoke --template sam.native.yaml --event {json test file}
-----
\ No newline at end of file
+----
+
+== Tracing with AWS XRay and Graal
+
+If you are building native images, and want to use https://aws.amazon.com/xray[AWS XRay Tracing] with your lambda
+you will need to include `quarkus-amazon-lambda-xray` as a dependency in your pom.  The Aws Xray
+library is not fully compatible with Graal so we had to do some integration work to make this work.

timeline.bodyText: If you need Jackson, you should include the quarkus-jackson extension rather than doing that.
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: Don't think I can do that.  This is a third party jar I'm "hacking" in.  Can't change the third party.
replies.author: patriot1burke

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                <description>Modifications to allow Xray to run with Quarkus Lambda support</description>
          
          
            
                <description>Allows X-Ray to run with Quarkus Lambda support</description>
          
      
    
    
  

(this description is the one we get on code.quarkus.io)
timeline.author: gsmet
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,57 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
+         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
+    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
+
+    <parent>
+        <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
+        <artifactId>quarkus-amazon-lambda-xray-parent</artifactId>
+        <version>999-SNAPSHOT</version>
+        <relativePath>../pom.xml</relativePath>
+    </parent>
+
+    <artifactId>quarkus-amazon-lambda-xray</artifactId>
+    <name>Quarkus - Amazon Lambda Xray - Runtime</name>
+    <description>Modifications to allow Xray to run with Quarkus Lambda support</description>
